newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish police chief removed from office.
newsitem.headline: Turkish police chief removed from office.

text.p: The chief of the Turkish police force, Alaatin Yuksel, was removed from office on Tuesday, an interior ministry spokesman told Reuters.
The spokesman declined to give further details on the decision.
Yuksel was removed from his post "because it was deemed necessary," an interior ministry statement quoted by the state-run Anatolian news agency said.
Kemal Celik, governor of the eastern province of Hakkari, was appointed acting police chief in Yuksel's place.
Yuksel has been appointed as acting governor of Cankiri province near Ankara, Anatolian said.
